messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Trying to locate movie title
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lisa, This is a Canadian film made by Zacharias Kunuk, an Inuit filmaker.  It s called Atanarjuat, The Fast Runner and is in Inuktitut, subtitled in
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lisa,

This is a Canadian film made by Zacharias Kunuk, an Inuit filmaker. It's
called "Atanarjuat, The Fast Runner" and is in Inuktitut, subtitled in
English and runs about three hours. I have not (to my dismay) seen it yet,
but know folks who have liked it very much. It is based on an Inuit legend
and won Canadian film awards, plus the Cannes Palme d'or for Best First
Feature Film. It's available in DVD, but not sure about VHS.

You can Google it, too. This review looked good:
www.scifinoir.com/reviews/atanarjuat.html

Robin B., in White Rock, BC

P.S. This is my first post on this list (invited by Tia, been lurking for
months). Will do an intro shortly.

Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Trying to locate movie title


> Dear Unschoolers: Has anyone seen an Eskimo movie acted and written by
> Eskimos? I can't seem to find any web site on it. I heard it was
> called "Fast Runner." Has anyone know or seen it? Thank you. Lisa of
> MT

messages.subject: Trying to locate movie title
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Unschoolers:  Has anyone seen an Eskimo movie acted and written by Eskimos?  I can t seem to find any web site on it.  I heard it was called Fast
messages.messageBody:
Dear Unschoolers: Has anyone seen an Eskimo movie acted and written by
Eskimos? I can't seem to find any web site on it. I heard it was
called "Fast Runner." Has anyone know or seen it? Thank you. Lisa of
MT


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
